results.title: I Call It Murder
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man Alive”. Broadcast U.K. November 1979
The results of drastic cuts in America’s health services are seen in the greatly reduced availability of free hospital treatment. Looks at the situation in a Chicago hospital serving the ghetto areas, which faces closure

results.title: The Work of the World Health Organisation
results.creator_credit: Janine Hamel-Minne, United Nations and World Health Organisation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man Alive”.
Traces the history of the World Health Organisation from early attempts to develop an international program for prevention of epidemics to the current promotion of health. Also gives an overall view of the work and activities of the Organisation.

results.title: That certain age
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man Alive”
Discusses the times in a woman’s life when she is faced with change - change in family life when children grow up, change in feelings about herself, more self confident, but at the same time afraid that she is no longer attractive to men, and change in the biological sense of the menopause. It is a time when she’s either got everything she ever longed for, or has to face up to never having what she wants.

results.title: Six of the best?
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man Alive”.
This film discusses the problem of how to control the unruly young - whether it is best to persuade, punish or to beat. Shows a row about corporal punishment in a detention school; an argument in every home in the country; headmasters vote overwhelmingly to retain the cane; parents in difficulty struggle to find a way to discipline.

results.title: A Proper little mother to them all
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man Alive”.
How does the oldest girl in a family look after her brothers and sisters when the mother has died or gone away? This film is about two such cases. Seventeen-year-old Carole who lost her mother through cancer a year ago, now looks after six young brothers and sisters on her own. Frances, who comes from a family of twelve however, has a father who works and provides for the family, and a Home Help who also does a lot of hard work for the twelve children, but Frances is the only mother the younger children will ever know.

results.title: Pot
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man Alive”.
Desmond Wilcox introduces and acts as interviewer/chairman with an audience of schoolboys, parents, doctors, & man from the council for civil Liberties, other scientists, a policeman, released pot smokers & others, to discuss the pros & cons of legalising cannabis in the U.K.

results.title: People in chains
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man Alive”.
Talks with people who have faced the dilemma of whether to sacrifice themselves looking after dependent relatives or hand the responsibility to the authorities. They have chosen the way of family loyalty, a strangely strong call of duty. The problem of dependents is one which has concerned society for a long time. In the end the responsibility lies with the individual - a member of the family. They are the “people in chains”.

results.title: My parents don't understand me
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man Alive”.
Kathy Westen ran away from home at sixteen, was found six months later living rough, sleeping in derelict houses. Now she is at home again - at least for the time being. She left because she could not make her parents understand her. They worried because they could not understand what she was trying to tell them. Kathy’s act of throwing away the comforts and securities of home life represents the communication gulf between parents and their children today.

results.title: Marriage under stress: Put asunder
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man Alive”.
The man, the woman - and the children - of broken marriages. Second-hand people? Or is it just the way everyone else treats them? What happens when a marriage is finally over? Who suffers most? And what chance of a new life is there for men and women who have been “put asunder?” Today more marriages than ever end in divorce courts but the bitterness does not always stop with divorce, and children sometimes become the ammunition between parted parents.

description_for_label:
Episode of Series “Man Alive”.
The man, the woman - and the children - of broken marriages. Second-hand people? Or is it just the way everyone else treats them? What happens when a marriage is finally over? Who suffers most? And what chance of a new life is there for men and women who have been “put asunder?” Today more marriages than ever end in divorce courts but the bitterness does not always stop with divorce, and children sometimes become the ammunition between parted parents.

results.title: Marriage under stress: children make the difference
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man Alive”.
Discusses factors which contribute to the break-up of marriages. Millions of married couples see bringing up children as fulfilling as worthwhile. While for others the first real stress of marriage comes with the arrival of children.
